summary: This is an email update regarding the autopsy of Jeffrey Epstein, detailing initial findings including ligature marks, petechial hemorrhage, a fractured hyoid bone, and deep tissue bleeding. It notes the medical examiner withheld a final cause and manner of death pending further studies and that Epstein's family hired a private pathologist to observe.

persons.name: Dr. Roman
persons.context: The medical examiner who performed or oversaw Jeffrey Epstein's autopsy and would not provide a final cause and manner of death at that time, pending additional studies.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the autopsy report; his death is being investigated, with injuries noted as consistent with hanging.

events.title: Epstein Autopsy Update
events.description: An email update is sent detailing preliminary autopsy findings on Jeffrey Epstein, including injuries consistent with hanging, but with the final cause and manner of death withheld pending further studies.

events.title: Epstein Autopsy Performed
events.description: The autopsy of Jeffrey Epstein is performed, revealing ligature marks, petechial hemorrhage, a fractured hyoid bone, and deep tissue bleeding. The family's private pathologist is present.

keyFacts: Preliminary autopsy findings on Jeffrey Epstein included ligature marks around the neck, petechial hemorrhage in the eyes, and a fractured hyoid bone, all noted as consistent with the circumstances of his death.
Deep tissue bleeding to the left shoulder/scapula area was believed to be caused by the position in which he hung himself.
The medical examiner, Dr. Roman, withheld the official cause and manner of death pending additional studies (histology, neuropathology, toxicology).
Epstein's family hired a private pathologist who was present to observe the autopsy.
